# The 5 Best Open Source Asana Alternatives in 2024


Asana is a popular project management tool, but it's not open source. If you're looking for an open source alternative to Asana, you're in luck! In this article, we'll take a look at the top 5 open source alternatives to Asana in 2023.


## 1. AFFiNE


AFFiNE is a next-generation knowledge base that serves as an open source, privacy-focused, local-first alternative to Notion. With AFFiNE, you can create workspaces and docs in plain text, Markdown, and blocks, including text, headings, images, databases, to-do lists, and numbered lists. AFFiNE offers seamless switching between Paper and Edgeless modes, empowering your workspace with powerful benefits such as online synchronization, multiplayer collaboration, and the ability to share your workspaces online with others. AFFiNE's flexibility and customizability make it a great choice for teams looking to streamline their workflow and collaboration.


## 2. Taiga


Taiga is an open source project management platform that offers a wide range of tools and features. With Taiga, you can manage tasks, sprints, backlogs, and issues. Taiga also offers a Kanban board and a customizable dashboard, making it a great choice for agile teams.


## 3. Odoo


Odoo is an open source ERP and project management tool that offers a wide range of features, including CRM, accounting, and inventory management. With Odoo, you can manage tasks, projects, and teams all in one platform. Odoo also offers a mobile app, making it easy to manage your projects on the go.


## 4. Kanboard


Kanboard is an open source project management tool that focuses on simplicity and ease of use. With Kanboard, you can manage tasks and projects using a Kanban board. Kanboard also offers a wide range of plugins and integrations, making it easy to customize your workflow and collaboration.


## 5. ProjectLibre


ProjectLibre is an open source project management tool that offers a wide range of features, including Gantt charts, calendars, and resource management. With ProjectLibre, you can manage tasks, projects, and teams in a user-friendly interface. ProjectLibre is also compatible with Microsoft Project, making it easy to import and export your projects.



---


In conclusion, there are plenty of open source alternatives to Asana that offer powerful project management tools and features. Whether you need a platform like AFFiNE that is tailored to knowledge management and collaboration, or a tool like Taiga that is optimized for agile workflows, there's an open source alternative out there for you. So why not give one of these top 5 open source Asana alternatives a try in 2023? You might be surprised at how much more efficient and productive your team can be!
